gale:repo.gale:text: various models, like the [[domain-model|domain model]], and languages, like [[gam|GAM]], used throughout [[../gale|GALE]] to perform adaptation

To retrieve content and perform adaptation, [[../gale|GALE]] needs information about the problem [[domain-model|domain]], and the [[user-model|user]]. How events update the user model is described in the [[adaptation-model|adaptation model]].
Languages, like [[gam|GAM]] and [[gale-code|GALE (EL) code]], allow the description of the dynamic behavior of the application.

For adaptation to work, an adaptive system needs to know how to respond to user events, whether to update the [[user-model|user model]], and how this model effects the content that is presented to the user. GALE relies on a [[domain-model|domain model]] describing the application or course. This model is also used to store the adaptive behavior or [[adaptation-model|adaptation model]].
One of GALE's features is a language that describes the domain and adaptation models, and the ability to store these models in a location relative to the actual content. This allows authors to create adaptive applications without ever knowing about a particular GALE server. The language to create these models is [[gam|]]. Alternatively, they can also be described in an XML format called [[gdom|GDOM]].
The [[gam|GAM]] language relies heavely on the programming language used to describe adaptivity. Though any programming language could be used, the default is Java (1.5). Accessing GALE's models is such a fundamental task that the language was extended with a special syntax to access them. The result is called [[gale-code|GALE (EL) code]].
